name: UNESCO RAM
methodology: Qualitative assessment across 5 dimensions using multi-stakeholder consultations, desk research, and national workshops. Produces actionable policy recommendations.

name: Stanford HAI
fullName: Stanford HAI AI Index / Global Vibrancy Tool
methodology: Tracks AI progress across research, economy, education, diversity, policy. Global AI Vibrancy Tool enables cross-country longitudinal comparison.

name: Tortoise Global AI
methodology: 122 indicators from 24 data sources across 7 pillars. Composite scoring with weighted averages.

name: Oxford Insights
fullName: Oxford Insights Government AI Readiness Index
methodology: 40 indicators across 3 pillars measuring government capacity to implement AI in public services.

name: GIRAI
methodology: 19 thematic areas across 3 dimensions measuring responsible AI governance and capabilities. UNESCO-endorsed.

name: IMF AIPI
methodology: Measures economy-level preparedness for AI adoption across 4 dimensions. Focuses on macroeconomic impact readiness.

name: World Bank 4Cs
fullName: World Bank Digital Progress & Trends Report 2025
methodology: 4Cs framework assessing AI foundations in developing countries: Connectivity, Compute, Competencies, Compatibility.

name: ICESCO AI Index
fullName: ICESCO AI Index for the Islamic World
methodology: Tailored index implementing the Riyadh Charter on AI for Islamic World. Covers leading OIC states with plans to expand.

name: OECD AI Observatory
methodology: Comprehensive policy tracking, AI incidents monitoring, compute metrics, and regulatory analysis for OECD members and partners.
